page.title: 01General View of the Block
page.content: Our block lies in the county of Fife with the villages of Hill of Beath and Kingseat and part of the town of Cowdenbeath inside it.In the middle of the block is the M90 motorway running from Edinburgh to Perth.Hill of Beath is only about one mile or so from the motorway.Most of the land is used for farming,mainly grazing for sheep and cows.Once coal was mined around the Hill of Beath and Cowdenbeath areas.Now all these pits have closed down but some new industries have been set up.Some local people work in these factories but many travel farther to go to work _Mossmorran petro-chemical plant,Rosyth naval dockyard,shops and offices in Dunfermline.The landscape of the area is changing with the opencast mining,the building of a new dual carriageway and new housing.
